verses.verse: And Joseph<WH3130> fell<WH5307> upon<WH5921> his father's<WH1> face,<WH6440> and wept<WH1058> upon<WH5921> him, and kissed<WH5401> him.

And Joseph<WH3130> commanded<WH6680> <WH853> his servants<WH5650> <WH853> the physicians<WH7495> to embalm<WH2590> <WH853> his father:<WH1> and the physicians<WH7495> embalmed<WH2590> <WH853> Israel.<WH3478>

And forty<WH705> days<WH3117> were fulfilled<WH4390> for him; for<WH3588> so<WH3651> are fulfilled<WH4390> the days<WH3117> of those which are embalmed:<WH2590> and the Egyptians<WH4714> mourned<WH1058> for him threescore and ten<WH7657> days.<WH3117>

And when the days<WH3117> of his mourning<WH1068> were past,<WH5674> Joseph<WH3130> spoke<WH1696> unto<WH413> the house<WH1004> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559> If<WH518> now<WH4994> I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in your eyes,<WH5869> speak,<WH1696> I pray you,<WH4994> in the ears<WH241> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559>

My father<WH1> made me swear,<WH7650> saying,<WH559> Lo,<WH2009> I<WH595> die:<WH4191> in my grave<WH6913> which<WH834> I have digged<WH3738> for me in the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> there<WH8033> shalt thou bury<WH6912> me. Now<WH6258> therefore let me go up,<WH5927> I pray thee,<WH4994> and bury<WH6912> <WH853> my father,<WH1> and I will come again.<WH7725>
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said,<WH559> Go up,<WH5927> and bury<WH6912> <WH853> thy father,<WH1> according as<WH834> he made thee swear.<WH7650>

And Joseph<WH3130> went up<WH5927> to bury<WH6912> <WH853> his father:<WH1> and with<WH854> him went up<WH5927> all<WH3605> the servants<WH5650> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> the elders<WH2205> of his house,<WH1004> and all<WH3605> the elders<WH2205> of the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714>

And all<WH3605> the house<WH1004> of Joseph,<WH3130> and his brethren,<WH251> and his father's<WH1> house:<WH1004> only<WH7535> their little ones,<WH2945> and their flocks,<WH6629> and their herds,<WH1241> they left<WH5800> in the land<WH776> of Goshen.<WH1657>
And there went up<WH5927> with<WH5973> him both<WH1571> chariots<WH7393> and<WH1571> horsemen:<WH6571> and it was<WH1961> a very<WH3966> great<WH3515> company.<WH4264>

And they came<WH935> to<WH5704> the threshingfloor<WH1637> of Atad,<WH329> which<WH834> is beyond<WH5676> Jordan,<WH3383> and there<WH8033> they mourned<WH5594> with a great<WH1419> and very<WH3966> sore<WH3515> lamentation:<WH4553> and he made<WH6213> a mourning<WH60> for his father<WH1> seven<WH7651> days.<WH3117>

And when the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land,<WH776> the Canaanites,<WH3669> saw<WH7200> <WH853> the mourning<WH60> in the floor<WH1637> of Atad,<WH329> they said,<WH559> This<WH2088> is a grievous<WH3515> mourning<WH60> to the Egyptians:<WH4714> wherefore<WH5921> <WH3651> the name<WH8034> of it was called<WH7121> Abel-mizraim,<WH67> which<WH834> is beyond<WH5676> Jordan.<WH3383>
And his sons<WH1121> did<WH6213> unto him according as<WH3651> <WH834> he commanded<WH6680> them:

For his sons<WH1121> carried<WH5375> him into the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> and buried<WH6912> him in the cave<WH4631> of the field<WH7704> of Machpelah,<WH4375> which<WH834> Abraham<WH85> bought<WH7069> with<WH854> the field<WH7704> for a possession<WH272> of a burial place<WH6913> of<WH4480> <WH854> Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite,<WH2850> before<WH5921> <WH6440> Mamre.<WH4471>

And Joseph<WH3130> returned<WH7725> into Egypt,<WH4714> he,<WH1931> and his brethren,<WH251> and all<WH3605> that went up<WH5927> with<WH854> him to bury<WH6912> <WH853> his father,<WH1> after<WH310> he had buried<WH6912> <WH853> his father.<WH1>

And when Joseph's<WH3130> brethren<WH251> saw<WH7200> that<WH3588> their father<WH1> was dead,<WH4191> they said,<WH559> Joseph<WH3130> will peradventure<WH3863> hate<WH7852> us, and will certainly requite<WH7725> <WH7725> us<WH853> all<WH3605> the evil<WH7451> which<WH834> we did<WH1580> unto him.
And they sent a messenger<WH6680> unto<WH413> Joseph,<WH3130> saying,<WH559> Thy father<WH1> did command<WH6680> before<WH6440> he died,<WH4194> saying,<WH559>

So <WH3541> shall ye say<WH559> unto Joseph,<WH3130> Forgive,<WH5375> I pray thee<WH577> now,<WH4994> the trespass<WH6588> of thy brethren,<WH251> and their sin;<WH2403> for<WH3588> they did<WH1580> unto thee evil:<WH7451> and now,<WH6258> we pray thee,<WH4994> forgive<WH5375> the trespass<WH6588> of the servants<WH5650> of the God<WH430> of thy father.<WH1> And Joseph<WH3130> wept<WH1058> when they spoke<WH1696> unto<WH413> him.
And his brethren<WH251> also<WH1571> went<WH1980> and fell down<WH5307> before his face;<WH6440> and they said,<WH559> Behold,<WH2009> we be thy servants.<WH5650>
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto<WH413> them, Fear<WH3372> not:<WH408> for<WH3588> am I<WH589> in the place<WH8478> of God?<WH430>

But as for you,<WH859> ye thought<WH2803> evil<WH7451> against<WH5921> me; but God<WH430> meant<WH2803> it unto good,<WH2896> to<WH4616> bring to pass,<WH6213> as it is this<WH2088> day,<WH3117> to save much people alive.<WH2421> <WH5971> <WH7227>
Now <WH6258> therefore fear<WH3372> ye not:<WH408> I<WH595> will nourish<WH3557> you, and your little ones.<WH2945> And he comforted<WH5162> them, and spoke<WH1696> kindly<WH5921> <WH3820> unto them.
And Joseph<WH3130> dwelt<WH3427> in Egypt,<WH4714> he,<WH1931> and his father's<WH1> house:<WH1004> and Joseph<WH3130> lived<WH2421> a hundred<WH3967> and ten<WH6235> years.<WH8141>

And Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> Ephraim's<WH669> children<WH1121> of the third<WH8029> generation: the children<WH1121> also<WH1571> of Machir<WH4353> the son<WH1121> of Manasseh<WH4519> were brought up<WH3205> upon<WH5921> Joseph's<WH3130> knees.<WH1290>

And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto<WH413> his brethren,<WH251> I<WH595> die:<WH4191> and God<WH430> will surely visit<WH6485> <WH6485> you, and bring<WH5927> you out of<WH4480> this<WH2063> land<WH776> unto<WH413> the land<WH776> which<WH834> he swore<WH7650> to Abraham,<WH85> to Isaac,<WH3327> and to Jacob.<WH3290>

And Joseph<WH3130> took an oath<WH7650> of<WH853> the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> God<WH430> will surely visit<WH6485> <WH6485> you, and ye shall carry up<WH5927> <WH853> my bones<WH6106> from hence.<WH4480> <WH2088>
So Joseph<WH3130> died,<WH4191> being a hundred<WH3967> and ten<WH6235> years<WH8141> old:<WH1121> and they embalmed<WH2590> him, and he was put<WH3455> in a coffin<WH727> in Egypt.<WH4714>
